review.reviewBody: I love the hipster style.  I also love the fact I can wash and dry quickly, especially when I am traveling.  What I do not love is all the tags on the underwear!  There are 3-4 tags in the back that are unnecessary.  Most clothes these days have tag information imprinted on the cloth.  This would be better than the tags which are annoying and bothersome and sometimes itchy.  You could put the washing information on the website or on a side tag.
review.name: Good, but ditch the tags!

name: Everyday Hipster Underwear - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I find this base layer works really well especially on hot days. I like the feeling of support it gives in addition to the technical transfer of moisture away from the body. It works really well.
If you're not a slim Italian size up
review.name: Great base layer

review.reviewBody:
I've been wearing undershirts on hot summer rides for years and have experience with a lot of different ones. These Castelli ones are my favorites so far, I liked it well enough I ordered a second one so I can spare myself a daily wash routine.  The fabric is light and the cooling qualities seem to work well, even in humidity.  I don't know if the cooling is light years ahead of other base layers, but I do like the way it seems to work with jerseys that also have some venting in the fabric (as most do these days). 

It's Castelli, so up one size from your usual (I've worn XL in Castelli since my first jersey), this fits the same as other tops I've purchased from them.
review.name: Great for summer heat

name: Active Cooling Sleeveless Baselayer - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great addition to our camping gear. I loved that it fit well on our stove and had a handle I could easily attach and detach as needed. I also love that it’s non stick!
review.name: Great pan

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wow is all I can say! I cooked scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage and left nothing behind on the pan. Easiest clean up for any pan I’ve owned! Love the design !
review.name: Portable !

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This 8 inch pan will be perfect for our summer camping trips! It is super portable due to the handle folding down. It seems to be made of super durable metal. I am excited to put this to use this summer over a camp fire!
review.name: Camping Luxury

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this for my husband who is expanding his camping gear and he was so excited and loves it so much! 
He used it with his single propane burner and it worked perfectly! 
It's a true nonstick, where nothing stuck to the pan. 
You're able to click the handle on and off which is pretty cool as well. 
Because of the nonstick feature it was really easy to clean. 
It's a great size, small enough that it's easy to store and travel with, but big enough to actually cook food in
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This pan is great. I love that the handle folds in and comes off, it's perfect for the grill! It's pretty decent size for two people. Love that it's nonstick, too!
review.name: So nice

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have not gone camping yet but I def will take this with me when I can. The pan is sturdy and the quality is great. I have been cooking up some eggs on my gas stove with this.
review.name: Sturdy little pan

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the coolest little travel/camping pan I’ve seen! I love how the handle is removable and is able to collapse so that it’s not taking up space. The quality is awesome, it’s durable. I haven’t tried it yet as I need to go camping first and will update this review on how it cooks, since it can only be used on a camping stove/fire. I never thought I would need one of these but it’s so convenient and now I definitely need more camp gear to try out from this brand! I love it!
review.name: Awesome!

name: Frontier UL 8in Pan

description: Buy the MSR Stake Hammer online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Stake Hammer
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Stake Hammer online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Good, light weight hammer for tent stakes. Good size striking head so you won’t be missing the stake head. I wish that it came with a cover for the head of the hammer as the claw portion is very sharp and it could tear my gear bag. For now, I’m wrapping the hammer with a rag to protect my bag.
review.name: Lightweight hammer for the job!

review.reviewBody: I bought mine on a deep sale. That’s the only time I’d recommend it.
review.name: It stakes good

review.reviewBody: Great tool. Has enough weight to drive stakes well but it is light enough to backpack with it. The claw is also the perfect size for pulling my stakes out of the ground.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: Great for any kind of trip, no only for stakes but I have use it to open coconuts, hitting a wood wedge instead of hitting a knife when I dont want to carry and axe in backpacking down river or in the beach. Used it for moving logs or bamboo and still holding up.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: The claw part is quite sharp, and exposed. The hammer should have a cover that slips over the claw. Otherwise great.
review.name: Great hammer, just wish it had a cover

review.reviewBody: I previously scoffed at the idea of getting this hammer, assuming I could always just find a rock. It turns out, there's a hand-sized rock shortage on a lot of trails and at many campsites, and a typical toolkit hammer isn't going to work on your stakes. A hatchet was also an interesting idea, but the prospect of accidentally cutting my fingers off was a bit off-putting (and the weight distribution of the hatchet really didn't facilitate hammering). In terms of hammering, this hammer does it well: it's light, the weight distribution is right, and it drives stakes into solid ground *very* well. The prongs on the back are perfect for pulling out stakes (which the cord on the bottom could also be used for if your stakes don't have cords), and would make for a great trowel. Also, you could probably use it as a meat tenderizer if you really wanted to, but that's probably unsanitary.
review.name: Lightweight and Fun

review.reviewBody: Heavy duty hammering for tough ground! Love this Hammer and use it a bunch!!
review.name: Get Hammered!!

review.reviewBody: Yes it is light weight! Drives and Pulls stakes, Check! Could be used in Self Defense if ever needed (hopefully not)! AND....it is the fastest Cat Hole Digger of All TIME! If you have ever tried to dig a Cat Hole in hard ground with that ultralight aluminum thing, you know what I mean. Flip that hammer and use those claws to dig a cat hole to speck ( 6" deep and as big as you feel necessary) in less than 30 seconds! The MSR Tent Stake Hammer is part of my base weight for good!!
review.name: Awesome Stake Hammer AND....

review.reviewBody:
I bought this hammer on a whim, but also because it looks like a hammer Apple would make if they did make hammers. It does have a beauty to it.

The hammer though does what it needs to do. It will hammer in tent stakes. I use MSR Groundhogs and it does the job on those. It also can pull them out too, like, you know, A HAMMER.

And now we come to my two complaints about it. One is justifying its existence in your backpack. Sure, a rock isn't awesome to use for getting tent stakes in, but it also isn't something you have to carry with you in your backpack that weighs over half a pound and takes up space. The other complaint I have is long term durability. The handle is hollow and the head is bound to it by a single pin. It feels very sturdy, but I don't know how long that pin is going to hold for.

I wouldn't say you have to have this hammer, and it does feel frivolous to me, but it's the lightest and most elegant hammer I've ever owned, and let me tell you, there was stiff competition for that honor. If you're going for ultralight, you're not on this product page, even considering this thing, but if you want some convivence with getting your tent stakes in and out with some minor weight and volume cost, you could do worse than this hammer.
review.name: The Most Elegant of Hammers

review.reviewBody: Sea kayaking isn't so weight restricted as climbing or backpacking, but things still add up. I try to bring items that can serve multiple functions, so devoting space and weight to such a specific tool was not an intuitive choice. But this stake hammer has the feel of a well-crafted tool and does that one job so incredibly well that I'm just going to have to find other uses to justify its place in my gear bag. The balance is perfect for what it's made to do. The size and weight are the minimum necessary to accomplish the task and still be, well, a hammer.
review.name: Perfect design for the job.

name: Stake Hammer

review.reviewBody: I order these pants and after wearing 3 or 4 times casually (not hiking or climbing), the thigh pocket zipper became detached. I contacted Backcountry and they shipped me a replacement pair. Unfortunately the replacement pair, after wearing twice, had the exact same defect. Backcountry refunded me. I honestly like these pants in all other regards. They are comfortable, I love the cinch on the ankle, they fit nicely, however, if you are someone who uses the thigh pocket, like me, then I cannot recommend this pair of pants. If you don't use the thigh pocket then these are dang good pants, though they might run a little on the large size.
review.name: Two Defective Pairs

review.reviewBody: I am pleasantly surprised, I actually like them. Comfortable, good freedom of movement. I wear them most days walking/hiking, for gym workouts, and lounging. In a couple of weeks they will get a climbing workout in Yosemite.
review.name: My first pair(s) of modern outdoor pants

review.reviewBody: These pants are breathable and have just the right amount of stretch. The belt is good, too!
review.name: Comfy pants!

review.reviewBody:
These pants are great for multi-day fly fishing trips. They’re lightweight but durable and the drawstring in the waist and legs is super helpful. 


The waist and the medium fit me like a tapered pant. Could have been large but the waist just a few inches too loose and would have been a bagger fit overall. 

Backcountry make these in more colors please!
review.name: Amazing summer pant!

review.reviewBody: Ordered small, and at 5'7", the inseam is way too long, made for super thin guys above 6ft, do not order these.
review.name: Inseem too long

review.reviewBody: Wear this pants for 4 days. Super comfy. Not so hot when 25c and warm in 10c. No odor even in day 4.
review.name: Very comfy and odor resist

review.reviewBody:
The backcountry ripstop line is the best, from these pants to the shorts. I wear them everyday during the summer months.

These pants are great, I typically put them in my pack when hiking as they are very lightweight and compact. Use them when the mosquitos, it's a bit cold or we've got some serious bushwacking to do.

10/10 would recommend
review.name: best pants out there

review.reviewBody:
I don't know how this poor fitting and cheap material pants got nearly 5 stars rating.
I'm about 5'7, 140 and a runner. These pants don't have standard fitting unless you have super skinny legs.
The material is cheap not even worth 10 bucks. So, I sent my order back to backcountry.
review.name: Terrible fitting and material

review.reviewBody: Great for climbing and hiking. They look good and feel good and are great for keeping ticks away.
review.name: Great pants and very comfortable

name: Wasatch Ripstop Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I love the dual texture of the fleece and insulated quilted areas. Together with the contrasting colors, it gives the classic fleece jacket an unique twist.
review.name: Fleece is warm and beautiful

review.reviewBody: Got it for my husband for Christmas and he couldn’t have been happier! He loved the bright colors, I think he’ll wear it often and it will be great for skiing!
review.name: My husband loves it!

review.reviewBody: I love the quality of this fleece!! It is such a good everyday wear that keeps me warm in the winter. I did want it to be oversized, so I sized up, but it was a tad bit bigger than I thought it would be. Still an amazing product!
review.name: Great Fleece

review.reviewBody: So happy to find this quarter zip with the pocket which is perfect for his phone! love the color combination, great price and quality and brand!
review.name: Christmas gift for husband

review.reviewBody: Excellent style and quality. Nice colors. Bought as gift for my son for Christmas.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody:
Quality, color and design are fabulous!
This will be a wonderful gift.
review.name: Just lovely

review.reviewBody: This is a very well fit sweater. Comfy and flashy.
review.name: Nice fit and comfy with a plus for the color combo!

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the Abrazo Half-Zip Fleece Jacket, and it has quickly become a staple in my wardrobe. The fleece is incredibly soft and warm without adding bulk, making it perfect for layering on cooler days. The design is sleek and modern, with a versatile color palette that pairs easily with a variety of outfits. The half-zip feature allows for convenient temperature control, making this jacket ideal for everything from outdoor activities to casual everyday wear.
review.name: Abrazo Half-Zip Fleece Jacket

review.reviewBody: This is an awesome fleece! It fits perfectly and keeps me warm! The colors are eye catching!
review.name: Awesome fleece

review.reviewBody: Great sweater to layer or when waking up in a cold morning.
review.name: Comfortable and cozy

review.reviewBody: Great company! This was my 2nd replacement hat from the original. Can’t beat their replacement guarantee!
review.name: Great company, great service!

review.reviewBody:
This is a great hat for any who spend a lot of time in the sun. So much cooler than most ball cap style hats. Much better air flow and space for your head to breath.
It is an excellent choice for any fisherman who spends many hours out on the lake like I do. Provides great comfort and sun protection as well as shading your eyes so along with your polarized sunglasses one can see deep into the water.
Speaking of sunglasses you will find the built in sunglasses holder alone is worth the  purchase price!
review.name: A great outdoorsman hat

review.reviewBody: Love this hat, fantastic coverage from sun & comfortable fit.
review.name: Charter Escape Hat

review.reviewBody: Great hat... Unfortunately only lasted a week. Ordered it for my wife before a cruise... While on an excursion, the hat, despite being chinched under her chin, blew off into the water and we couldn't recover it. Would definitely buy it again.
review.name: Great hat for a week

review.reviewBody: I had high hopes for this hat and what can I say boy did it deliver.  I had been looking for a new hat to replace my larger outback hats for doing yard work and just running around town.  I was a little concerned about the brim sizing, but it was actually perfect.  The team really did a great job taking the cut into consideration to achieve that perfect style.  If your looking for the outdoorsman style without the large 3" brim then this is the hat for you!
review.name: Just Awesome

review.reviewBody: A great hat, love it. Wore one out this is my second one.
review.name: Great Hat

review.reviewBody: Perfect hat for my husband, brim is not too big, he looks great in it!!!
review.name: Great looking hat

review.reviewBody: Really appreciate an amazing sun hat where the brim is 360-degrees but isn't umbrella sized. Also, it's bluesign material on top of Sunday Afternoons having a "giving back" program. Thanks for doing that.
review.name: Perfect Brim Size

review.reviewBody: I really like the option to be able to adjust the hat for the fit you want and need.  Good quality and great gray color. Like the option of color choices.
review.name: Really like the adjustable fit.

review.reviewBody: I've spent a lot of money looking for the perfect hat for me, and I found it.👍
review.name: Awesome hat.

name: Charter Escape Hat

review.name: I love this dress and

review.reviewBody: Size up, it’s very fitted. Beautiful classic dress you will have for the next 10 years! Incredibly soft and fashionable!
I bought four different dresses from beyond yoga and this one is my favorite. It hugs ALL THE RIGHT PLACES and even though I bought this for a casual soccer mom look, it is very very flattering

Highly recommend!

review.reviewBody: This is my first Beyond Yoga purchase. I love the quality and softness of this dress. Excited to take on my vacation!

review.reviewBody: I am a solid size 37. These feel more like a 36. Shoe seems nice and could be comfortable if it were the correct size. I like a wide toe box as I usually wear toe shoes but my big toes were very squished in these. I'm keeping the Shimano shoes I ordered to try on instead. Bummer as these were on a super good sale and the Shimano's were at least 2x more expensive. I would say they are worth trying!
review.name: Returned

review.reviewBody:
Looks like it belongs on the golf course but performs like a great MTB shoe. After a dozen+ park days and three DH races, you'd be hard pressed to find much wear on these shoes. Flexible enough to walk around but stiff enough to ride DH bike all day w/o foot or leg cramps. Fit is comfortable and padding is adequate.

Only real complaint is the ankle collar area is not very snug which allows small mountain gravel to get inside the shoe. By no means a deal breaker. 

Would buy again and/or recommend to others.
review.name: High Hopes- Not Disappointed!

name: 2FO DH Clip Mountain Bike Shoe

description: Buy the Backcountry Wasatch Adventure Hydration Bra - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Wasatch Adventure Hydration Bra - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Wasatch Adventure Hydration Bra - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I was really excited about the concept. I ordered an XS (I’m a 32A in most bras) so I figured it would be perfect! However, the bra seems to run smaller than the size chart suggests and the only available sizes they have left are XS (which is the one I got and is too tight) or L/XL. No way for me to exchange it for a S which I think would be ideal after trying on the XS. Not sure what to do with the one I purchased now. The concept seems great. The sizing and lack of size options available is really unfortunate.
review.name: Almost a great purchase

review.reviewBody: So far I used it for a 10 and 12 mile run and it was comfortable even in the Texas 💯 degree weather and humidity. Wearing a hydration vest seems excessive for such short distances and am afraid of being too hot and water wooshing around when I run so this works great for me.  I didn’t notice the neckline being too high to be bothersome as others mentioned. Also, I  have like no boobs so I  am not sure how it would work for someone with more volume since there would be no strap directly  under your breast to hold them in place. The only support would be from the compression it self.  I do wish they had more colors!
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: Fits very snug. Should size up if you want it to hold hydration bottles. Snug fit around neck. Still unclear what size or kind of bottles this vest would hold.
review.name: Hydration Sports Bra

review.reviewBody: I have been running since 1998 and have tried every new bra, hydration pack (back, arm, hip, hand, etc…) and shorts. I got this specifically for my 2-3 hour excursions.  I typically wear my ultimate direction hydration pack for all my trail runs just so I have a place to carry water/fuel and my phone. I also sometimes wear a belt to put my phone in. This bra was perfect for my shorter trail runs. I hate wearing a hydration vest when I know I only want about 8oz of water, my phone and my car key. I have put my iphone14 in both the front mesh chest pocket and the back pocket at the bottom band.  The back pocket doesn’t have zippers but the phone stays put. I put it there when I know I don’t plan on taking it out for pictures, I just want to move fast. The smaller pockets were perfect for me and my GU chomps and ID. I read the other reviews about the high neckline but I didn’t notice that at all. Obviously if you pack everything into all the pockets it will become heavy, so for all day hikes I’ll stick to a true vest but for my hikes/runs that are only 1-3 hours in length, this bra is PERFECT. It allows me to pack the bare minimum and still feel light.   Great for shorter trail races in the mtns when there aren’t a lot of aid stations but you want to have some extra water/fuel with you.
review.name: Great unique design

review.reviewBody:
I have used this a few times and it is pretty comfortable, but the pockets are all just a tad off for me. I would not recommend this for longer trail runs. I feel like this is better for mid to longer urban runs when you don't need to carry much of anything. 

 The water bottle pockets are a bit high and the lid of my flasks sit right in my neck. Those pockets could fit a smaller phone, but mine was too large (a google pixel with case). It does not carry that much and if you need to put layers in the back pocket mid run you need a friend to help or strip mid trail (which I am not doing). You could stash a small jacket or layer in the back pocket before a run and access it pretty easy, but then if you want to take the jacket off you are putting it around your waist. 

The back poles pocket is also way to small for poles. and the side pockets are good for keys and a goo or two, but it would be a tight/ impossible fit for granola bars/ phone/ anything larger than a credit card.

In terms of fit, I think it is super comfortable, but a bit hot in for warmer climates and agree with previous reviews that say the neckline is a bit high.
review.name: Not for Longer Trails

review.reviewBody: I bought this looking for an alternative to a vest for mid distance runs that I want to carry a little water and a few other things. I have one slight grip and that is that I wish the neckline wasn’t so high. As I started my run, I didn’t notice it but while o was driving and getting ready, I unzipped a bit. The material was great and the fit was snug so I do think that sizing is really important to make this work for you. I do think the price is excessive since it rivals that of high end packs but I bought it on sale and am pleased with it.
review.name: An excellent concept!

review.reviewBody: Favorite things about this sports bra:  1) front zipper means no dislocating a shoulder to get it on or off. 2) longline style means it plays very nice with a heart rate monitor. 3) POCKETS.
review.name: Three Things

name: Wasatch Adventure Hydration Bra - Women's

review.reviewBody: Leg loops have virtually no stretch, the design is a major step backward from the old version as this greatly limits the leg loop size. Only positive is the rear gear loops have slightly more rigidy and the larger haul loop is appreciated.
review.name: Major devolution

review.reviewBody: Fragile shaft!    Snapped one pole slightly above the basket 1st day in use.  Pole shaft brushed an open boot buckle.

comment: Thank you for your review, Scott. We are sorry your carbon pole broke after coming in contact with your boot buckle. Our Carbon poles are rigid and featherweight, but more easily compromised than aluminum poles especially when contacting something sharp, such as the edge of a ski or a metal boot buckle. If you have not reached out to our customer service team yet please do, so that we can arrange a replacement.

review.reviewBody: Simply the best poles and grips made for skiing. The Trigger 3D SL grip and click in release mechanism ensure your hand is in the right position and feels great! They are super lightweight and stylish, so form meets function in this perfect package!

Pros
Great Fit
MIPS system for protection
Easy to Adjust

Cons

review.reviewBody:
My husband got these pants ten years ago when he was an adventurous 20-something living in the Andes mountains of Peru. They were his trusty hiking pants for daily use as he hiked up and down mountains for two years.

Fast forward ten years and they’re still his favorite work pants, but after a decade of heavy use, they’re just now beginning to wear thin. I bought him the exact same pair for Father’s Day, and he was thrilled. 

Here’s to another decade of adventures in these pants!
review.name: Repeat customer

review.reviewBody:
Perfect fit for larger butt and thighs.
Breathable for warm weather.
review.name: Perfect Hot Weather Pants

review.reviewBody: I like these pants a a lot - fabric, fit, function. BUT,  I ordered them in the "Gun Metal" color. It looks like a medium gray color on both the Backcountry and Kuhl websites, and of course the name suggests gray too. However, these pants are nothing like gray at all. They are a deep olive green color, like military fatigues but a little darker. Kuhl has a color named "Pine Grove"  and these gun metal pants look like they are that color.  In fact,  At first I thought there had been a shipping mistake but then saw the tag attached tot he pants says "Gun Metal."  On Kuhl's website you can find several other customer reviews saying essentially " I ordered gun metal, but instead they are green."  So, if you want gray pants, don't order the gun metal color! I'm returning mine and will order a different color and hope the picture for that one  more closely resemble the actual color of the pants. I deducted two stars for inaccurate color but when I get that sorted out I lnow I'll like the pants a lot. I already have Kuhl shorts and wear them all the time.
review.name: Great pants, color not correct

review.reviewBody: I like the fit of this style. Light and comfortable. But compared to those I purchased in the late 00s, the quality is not the same. No double fabric at the heel; pocket liners made from something like nylon stockings; and one of the rivets just popped off (I only wear these for office and around the town - not hiking). Considering how high-priced Kuhl clothing is, I expect MUCH better.
review.name: Good fit, lower quality

review.reviewBody: I?ve only had them a day and I?m already planning to buy more.  Love the stretch, the pockets, the feel, and how much I can move however I want! Awesome.  There is only one thing I can think of that would add to these pants.  A Velcro closure on the back pockets. Add that and they would be perfect.
review.name: I love these pants

review.reviewBody: These are a great fit.   Very Comfortable and stylish.   I've got some big thighs and they have room but no too much room.  Thanks
review.name: Super Happy to have purchased these!

review.reviewBody: Pants are awesome they fit well, look good,  and i can wear them for most of my daily activities. The only improvement i could think would be to give them a little bit of stretch, they are pretty stiff but thats what kept them looking the most presentable.
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: Not US sized. Inconsistent color.Quality plummeted with buyout. Thin tissue paper material ,worst pants I ever purchased. Not even worth deep discount. Stay away cheapest materials.
review.name: Wish I could give zero stars , low quality comically small

review.reviewBody: Extremely tight in thighs, and they are not elastic in any way. They seem like great pants, but they are NOT made for those with small waists and large quads. You know, like people who are active and hike. They must be made for craft beer enjoyers with stick legs.
review.name: If you workout, beware…

review.reviewBody:
I have been wearing these pants for two days straight since receiving them. I've mostly worn them sitting in my chair at work, but I did go for a bike ride. I love the buttons on the pant legs. I've basically worn them with the ankles rolled up from the second I put them on and I love it. They keep the pants rolled up and keep them high enough to keep the pant leg off the crank when riding a bike.

These pants look great in the office or anywhere. I love the fit and the look.

My only complaint, which is why I gave it 4-stars instead of 5 is that there is no inherent stretch in these pants. I have a bulbous butt which causes the pants to feel slightly tight in the pelvis area. I assume the pants will stretch out a little as I wear them more, but at the moment, the pants are little tight. Otherwise, the fit is true to size. I typically wear a 38 waist and a 32 in length and these pants are perfect. I typically wear my pants with the cuff resting on the top of my foot and these land exactly on the top of my foot.

I love these pants. I will definitely buy more in the future.
review.name: Love the pants, but I wish they had a small amount of stretch.

review.reviewBody: Need at least a small level of stretch to make it practical for hiking or climbing. Good for around town but that’s not why I buy mountain hardware
review.name: Not good got outdoors

review.reviewBody: Great pair of pants. Very durable and dirt is easy to get off. They don’t stay looking dirty. Gonna get another pair
review.name: Solid pants!

review.reviewBody: The base of these are very wide and due to this the fabric is really too large on my medium width foot. Thus when I walk, it creates an extremely loud flip/flop sound which I find annoying and makes it feel like my foot is slipping around too much in the shoe. I much prefer the softer sound that the Mush flips have (and tighter fit around the foot). Grip on the bottom seems to be good. I have ordered the hydratrek sandals as a replacement hoping to get rid of that sound and get a better fit.
review.name: Very wide and loud flip/flop sound

review.reviewBody: I got these just in time for a week off of boating and bass fishing. I own probably 30 pairs of Teva Mush sandals. These Hydratrek Flips were so comfortable with great support! I definitely need a couple more pairs.
review.name: Wore a week straight right out of the box

review.reviewBody: For the Beach it's awesome, perfect support, comfort. Not as comfortable as I thought for wearing them for many days straight in the rough tho. I need Flips Flops for that. I ended up taking Ascona Flip for my two week Camping trip to N. Grand Canyon. I need Flips made with Materials like Ascona or another version as Ascona to be made.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: I didn't like how they felt on my feet. One shoe felt wonderful. The other shoe was tight.
review.name: I wouldn't buy again

review.reviewBody: This shoe doesn't match up to previous shoes I've purchased. And I've bought plenty. They are stiff and hard whereas I'm use to the softer teva.
review.name: Not as crazy about this one

review.reviewBody: I love these flips! Love the tan color, and use them in wet conditions which is where they shine...no slipping around either on the floor nor in the footbed. More padding and arch support in the footbed than your average flip flop. Footbed for the Hydratrek flip and sandal is *slightly* longer than my Terra Fi 5's but not enough to size down. Love Teva's for my wide feet.
review.name: Grippy when wet and ultra comfy

review.reviewBody: These flip-flops are heavy duty, have great traction, and are thick for long-lasting wear. The only reason I do not give 5 stars, is because I have very narrow feet and these are VERY wide. That's a plus for anyone who has wide feet and struggles to find comfy flip-flops. The Voya flip and Mush flip-flops have always fit me nicely, but these have about 3/4" of excess space on either side of each foot.
review.name: Really like these flip-flops. One problem though

review.reviewBody: Been wearing these a few weeks, with yardwork & all day errands. No farting noises. I have a wide foot, overpronate, usually like arch support, but these footbeds avoid painful aching for some reason. Wearing often in the water without the upper straps stretching out. Archies stretch out too much, Vionic also if they get wet.
review.name: All day wear, upper keeps its shape

review.reviewBody: I love Teva and always have...but you need to go back to the orinal grid on the flip flops, every company is doing this mush memory foam thing, it sucks. Your grid is the best for not slipping , you could promote this, no one has it. Please go back to grid. The mush is very slippery when wet♡♡♡♡♡♡♡
review.name: Flip flops

review.reviewBody: I love the comfort and the fact I won't slip around when my feet are wet but my feet make fart noises every time I step.
review.name: Foot farts with every step

review.name: Warmer than I expected

review.reviewBody: I bought these awhile back in a small but they were still too long and baggy. I’m 5’2” , 122 lbs.  Love the warmth and pockets but ended up giving them to my sister who is considerably taller than I am!
review.name: Way too big

review.reviewBody:
I've been on the hunt for some sweatpants I can wear on the trail (backpacking). I'm tired of being cold, and most sweatpants I've had are lackluster for a nights outdoors or way bulky.

While I haven't yet taken these on the trail (I'll return here to update whether they are just warm or are trail warm) but I've practically lived in them at my house since they arrived.

They are seriously the softest ever, and thinner than I anticipated. They feel surprisingly light for just moving about the house but retain warmth really well--much more than light movement and I'm WARM. 

Sizing is ample: I'm usually a 6/Medium in W's pants and, I ordered a small of these and they are perfectly oversized. If wanting a closer fit, I'd recommend sizing down. 

These are genuinely high-waisted! I have a long torso and most 'high-waisted' pants I have hit at/below my belly button. These actually sit at the small of my waist (above belly button) and the elastic waistband does its job without being uncomfortably tight. I also have endo so my stomach bloats a lot throughout the day--the elastic has been no issue and the roominess of the pants means I am comfortable regardless.

Overall: Blue color is true to picture, lighter weight fleece than anticipated but retains warmth really well, cozy/oversized fit, and I'm excited to put them to the test in the backcountry this summer. 

Regular wear recommendation: 10/10
Trail wear recommendation: TBD, will try to update
review.name: Softest ever :)

review.reviewBody: These are very warm and roomy. I sized down and there is plenty of room to wear leggings underneath.
review.name: Warm

review.reviewBody: I thought I bought W Small. Maybe they were M-small! I can’t tell-they are huge but so so cozy I don’t care! I wore them all winter. Straight home from work, threw them on!! I’ll have them for 20 years, I am sure of it. They are great quality!
review.name: So cozy!

review.reviewBody: Love the Polar Fleece Joggers. Perhaps they "run" a bit larger than I anticipated, but super comfortable and warm. I lounge at home in them. The price and value were fantastic.
review.name: Soft, warm & comfortable

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'10 and I am always extreeeemely hesitant whenever I buy joggers but boy did these prove me wrong. They even give a looser look where they bunch a bit at the bottom which I LOVE! Not to mention they are incredibly soft and I may just buy a second pair in case they don't bring these back again next year. If you're wondering if you should get them, trust me, just do it!
review.name: TALL GIRL FRIENDLY

review.reviewBody: I love how these were styled so I bought them and just love them. Nice and baggy fit, super soft. I’m coming back for another pair bc I plan to wear these every night and to every camping trip too
review.name: SO SOFT!

review.reviewBody: I wore these pants allllllll weekend at Jackson Hole - slept in them, brunched in them, threw them on immediately after skiing, you name it, I wore them. They are the comfiest / coziest pants, and the relaxed leg is a delight after a long day on the slopes (or a long day at the office). I'm also tall w/ a decent sized inseam and this is legit the first pair of joggers that I've purchased that are long enough for me.
review.name: Best Apres Pants!!

review.reviewBody: I have several Giro and Pearl Izumi shoes in 46, but after seeing the reviews here, I ordered these in 47. That's the way to go. I only have about 40 miles on these now. The initial impression is very positive, and I imagine the uppers will conform more over time, but you need to get the length correct from the start.
review.name: Go one size up

review.reviewBody:
Just received these as a Christmas gift. I own Specialized shoes, size 44, which fit well. I also own a different pair of Pearl Izumi in size 45 that fit well. These, 46, fit well around the foot but are too short. I'll have to return them. Unfortunately, they are not offered in a 46.5 which I think would be perfect. Too bad as they seem like great road shoes otherwise. 

I "normally" wear size 11 in street shoes with typical foot width if it helps anyone in making a size choice.
review.name: Run Small

review.reviewBody:
I wear a Size49 and got these in white.  The are used in conjunction with Speedplay Zero pedals and I use the F6 shims.  
The fit is good at 49; I do have narrower feet, but they still cinch up nicely without buckling.  If there is any appreciable stretch, that may be something to be less happy about over time.
After about 200km (3 rides), I can say they fit good and are comfortable.  They are easy on and off thanks to some elasticity around the ankle area.  The laces with the offset enclosure are really good and it makes me wonder why everyone is so sold on Boa.  They seem plenty stiff on climbs or putting the power down and are still somewhat normal to walk in.  nice trick!
I won't speak too ill of the shoes they were replacing, but these are sooo much better than the Torch 2.0, especially with fit around the tongue area.  Plus these are more affordable and in my size, these were 20g per shoe lighter.  I don't normally care too much on weight, but figured I would go ahead and measure while I was switching over my cleats just to make the review more interesting.  
I'll try to remember to chime back in after 2000km.  
POST 2000km update - 
Still really great.  They remain comfortable and plenty stiff.  I'll stick with them for the coming Spring.  Excited about that!  Most of my road rides are 2 - 4 hours with pretty typical 1000ft of elevation gain every 10 miles.  Great shoes for that kind of riding.
review.name: Comfortable and Lightweight

review.reviewBody:
Received these shoes today and really like the quality and look. I wear a size 9 all day long and I ordered the 42 sizing for this shoe. Fits like a glove and I have slightly narrow feet with a good arch. No issues whatsoever. Lightweight and throwback lacing style. Can?t wait to put these on the pedals. 

Fast shipping from Back Country!
review.name: Great purchase

review.reviewBody: Can't wait to get my new pair I'm only returning because I would like to be absolutely comfy when I clip these in.
review.name: .5 a size up please...

review.reviewBody: Very nicely made cycling shoe for the money. Quality materials used. True to size.
review.name: Quality Cycling Shoe

review.reviewBody:
Good shorts but not for $60. They do not look durable as hoped but good looking shorts and I will keep them. Will buy more of this brand when on sale but not worth it for full price.
Recommend buying somewhere else as well due to r eturn policy from this merchant and I was supposed to get 20% off full price item but didn't and no time too call/ figure it out.
review.name: Fit descent and comfortable

review.reviewBody: First week of use and already 3 different holes in it. Bummer as these were not cheap and I wasn't even doing anything that active.
review.name: Comfy  but hardly durable.

review.reviewBody:
There's not a ton to say other than these are a super solid athletic short for just about any activity. The material has an excellent hand to it, and moves well with you. 

Sizing wise - they may run slightly on the slim side, but I may just be running slightly on the thick side these days. 

Definitely a shorter length, but don't you think those thighs deserve some sun? 

Buy the shorts, ride the horse, take the trip, do the thing. (In these shorts of course)
review.name: Great short for any active venture.

name: Breakers 16.5in Ecolastic Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: I spent a lot of time searching for the perfect pack for long day hikes and to use for traveling as a personal item to hold a laptop, etc. This pack has exceeded expectations. It's very functional with enough pockets but not too many. The phone pocket is very convenient. The water bottle pockets are large but secure. The removable hip belt is brilliant. I am now a Mammut fan and will always search for their bags first. However, I am certain this bag will stick with me for many years.
review.name: Excellent pack: comfortable & versatile!

review.reviewBody: With a hip belt! Fits great, perfect for day hikes when you don't need to carry a ton but still want something structured. The phone pouch is a nice feature too. Don't really have any complaints!
review.name: Great little pack

description: Buy the Garmin Striker 4 + Dual-Beam Transducer online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Striker 4 + Dual-Beam Transducer
hasVariant.description: Buy the Garmin Striker 4 + Dual-Beam Transducer online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I really have been pleased with this fishfinder, especially at the price point. It is very clear and easy to read in sunny conditions and the sonar performs perfectly. It is good enough that after I bought it to replace a different brand on my kayak, I bought a Garmin Vivid 9sv and a UHD2 7cv for upgrading my boat electronics!   I love all 3!
review.name: Excellent clear display!

review.reviewBody: It work better than expected with our first usage after I installed it on our boat. Controller and the sonar transom transducer mounting were installed based on the instructions. Setup and tried the unit out at home to make sure everything worked. It worked fine. Yesterday, we used it on water and unit required very simple setup adjustments. GPS, depth finder and fish finder all worked great. Very good unit for the recreational boater and going fishing.
review.name: First Time Use Yesterday

review.reviewBody: I bought this to use at my pond, mainly for learning the contours of the pond and seeing what is down there. I was considering another unit, but it had bad reviews. We own all Garmin electronics on our bass boat, we have the latest electronics we can get and they all are great. The striker 4 showed me bait and fish in my pond. I could not have ask for anything better. I caught fish in the areas where the unti showed fish. This will be a useful tool for me I look forward to using for a long time.This unit is a great buy.
review.name: Love my Striker 4

review.reviewBody: I bought this about three weeks ago and have already caught so many more fish. I also found some spots to go after giant fish!
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: bought few weeks ago havent used so dont know how well it works
review.name: havent used yet

review.reviewBody: Great for kayak fishing. Great for people with budgets
review.name: Good fish finder

review.reviewBody: Unbelievable features for a inexpensive and easy to install device!
review.name: Nice!

review.reviewBody: I've only got to use this once and it worked very good for the price. Easy to go thru the setup screen and was easy to install. The gps feature is what sold me.
review.name: Nice little unit

name: Striker 4 + Dual-Beam Transducer

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have a few pairs of these Five Ten Sleuth Mountain Bike Shoes. For me, the heel support feels especially nice to wear. They are also nice to wear in both warm and cold temperature as I’ve been wearing them all summer and into the winter Midwest temps down to 15 degrees. 

I have the black/tan version. I tried the all black version but didn't like the how visible the graphic “5” is on the side of the shoe and returned them for a backup pair of the tan sole version that has a less prominent “5” on the side.
review.name: Swell made

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I like the shoes for both walking and biking. They look nice and not too chunky. Material on outside of shoe is solid but grip underneath wore out too quick. I have not even worworn the shoshoes for a full year and there is almost no ttraction under the front part of the shoe.
review.name: Nice looking. Should last longer!

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Despite of being called "Stealth" they are very noisy on regular wood / stone floor. Also the shoe tongue is too long and is bothering me very often.
review.name: Good, but can be better!

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice color but material needs improvement i like it
review.name: Good purchase

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] this is my 3rd pair of 5-10's, although it is my least favorite, still like them. I work in a business casual environment with a lot of walking, feet never hurt at the end of the day. Love the BA sleuth shoe. Color way is what makes it third.
review.name: 3rd pair...won't be the last.

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: improve the quality. After just 1 week earing it the canvas started separating from the rubber/sole.
review.name: deteriorated in 1 week

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My last pair of five tens for perfectly. This pair is two centimetres longer and way too big. Both are size 13. Why can't a company as big as Adidas get sizing right? And stitching on one shoe in two places came loose.
review.name: Adidas have changed their sizes; now too big

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very narrow, with no room in the toe box. I had to order a half size bigger than usual and they're still too cramped.

These aren't proper Five Ten shoes - stick to the original Freeriders.
review.name: Not proper Five Ten shoes

review.itemreviewed: Sleuth DLX Canvas Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Pines Microgrid Ultralight Baselayer Bottom - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I got the top and bottoms in these and I couldn’t be more satisfied. I’ve been rolling with ninja suits for over a decade and I wanted to switch it up this season. These base layers are stretchy, breathable, warm and super comfortable. I love grid fleece. For comparison, I’ve put Patagonia’s R1 layers through the wringer over the years with climbing and snowboarding and I know how versatile this fleece with grid construction is so I didn’t hesitate with these. For the fit, I’m 5’10”, 165lbs with a lean athletic build. Large top and medium bottoms fit perfectly. 
Highly recommend
review.name: Comfortable and Functional!

name: Pines Microgrid Ultralight Baselayer Bottom - Men's

review.itemreviewed: ER1600 DB Spline Disc Brake Wheel
review.reviewBody: I purchased a Trek Emonda for exercise and weight-loss.  I am a former century rider from the early 90?s and thought I would get into riding casually but later found myself drawn back to the riding community cycling more and more.  (Not a bad thing, right?)  Anyhow, the Bontrager TLR?s served me well.  I abused them.  Initially I was significantly over the weight limit for those wheels and they held up fairly well.  [greater than expected] When it came time to replace these wheels, I wanted DT Swiss because I was familiar with their reputation for building quality wheels.  DT Swiss are well known for producing excellent spokes and hubs used by competitor brands. Truthfully, I wanted a set of wheels with 240 hubs but that wheel set was out of my price range and ?well, I am still fond of abusing things and not really worrying about breaking anything but I digress.  I purchased these wheels a few months ago and have abused the mess out of them.  They have served me well.  They are a phenomenal wheel for the money.  If you are looking for the best value at this price point, you should really consider this wheelset.
review.name: Fantastic Upgrade

name: ER1600 DB Spline Disc Brake Wheel

description: Buy the Black Diamond UL Alpine Whippet Adze Attachment online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: UL Alpine Whippet Adze Attachment
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond UL Alpine Whippet Adze Attachment online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I'm really impressed with the lightness and beautiful design of this attachment. Integrates seamlessly with the new Black Diamond ski poles, and provides an extra margin of safety on sketchy days in the steeps and on the bootpack. This is a nice feature in addition to the ice axe, and really nice to have on steep days when you probably should be skiing with an ice axe. Lightweight and convenient packability make this a no-brainer to keep in your daily ski backpack.
review.name: Extra protection

review.reviewBody: Safety first! Whether splitboarding or hiking/climbing, in the split second it takes to lose your footing, this is the perfect tool to have. Always attached and ready to use when needed! Pairs perfectly with the BD John J compactor split poles!
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: Great poles - a bit lighter than my very old backcountry Black Diamond poles and the Whippet attachment will provide more peace of mind during hard snow spring conditions.
review.name: Great poles - a bit

review.reviewBody:
Recently acquired the Alpine Whippet Attachment from Black Diamond and it's quickly become a staple in my mountain treks. The design is robust yet lightweight, offering an added layer of safety without being a burden to carry.

Its seamless integration with existing Black Diamond poles is a big plus, allowing for quick adjustments in varied terrains. Notably, the self-arrest feature is a great add-on, giving a peace of mind during those steep descents.

Easy to install and remove, it's a straightforward yet invaluable tool for any alpinist. Highly recommended for safer and more confident mountain adventures!
review.name: Sturdy and Essential!

review.reviewBody: Super psyched to have this attachment on my whippet ski pole. Not only does it dig into steep snow for a.steep slope.climb, it also doubles as a handy hook around tree trunks and branches when approaching climbs in steep woods.
review.name: Whippet good!!

review.reviewBody: Very much looking forward to taking whippets on the alpine!
review.name: Whippets in the alpine

review.reviewBody: Looking forward to having this for extra stability in steep gullies
review.name: Looking forward to having this

review.reviewBody: The alpine whippet is a fine alternative to the traditional, pick version. Lighter for one; and likely as effective for the times we're crossing steep, hard snowfields. Great design!
review.name: great alternative whippet attachment

review.reviewBody:
For almost two decades I had been using a Grivel Condor self-arrest grip, mounted on a succession of adjustable poles from BD and Komperdell. When I first got a Condor, back then the original BD Whippet was not very convenient to remove. Then it became fixed. And changed yet again to become easily removable. But it still seemed like overkill, and perhaps even literally quite lethal.

Somehow I didn’t notice the Alpine Whippet until its third season now of existence. The design is easy to criticize since it obviously will have less purchase in hard snow or ice conditions than the regular Whippet, or even the Condor. However, I’ve always been skeptical of self-arrest realism when skiing. Hence I’m counting on a self-arrest ski pole grip only for a fall that starts from essentially zero speed, i.e., skinning with ski crampons, or booting up with boot crampons on pitches where I don’t need the self-belay of an ice axe. I’ve also been wary of the injury potential from a skiing fall with a Whippet (and a friend did indeed severely lacerate his hand that way).

The Alpine Whippet feels like a perfect compromise to me. The pick – okay, really an adze – protrudes far enough, and is sharp enough, and is hard enough to pull off a self-arrest in any condition in which you can reasonably self-arrest with a ski pole self-arrest grip. If the Alpine Whippet isn’t sufficient for that in certain conditions, then I doubt most – or perhaps even any – skiers will have the skill and strength to successfully pull of a self-arrest with the more aggressive steel pick of the regular Whippet. Yet the self-laceration hazard with an Alpine Whippet is rather minimal compared to the regular Whippet.

The attachment and removal technique is quick and easy. Only drawback is that upon attachment you then have to stow somewhere the little grip plug (that presumably is there to keep the grip’s inner threads clean, as well as for aesthetics), and then upon removal you need to stow somewhere the pick – sorry, adze – but it’s small and slim enough that it will get along well with the rest of your stowed sharps.

As for the poles, I’m using the BD Alpine Carbon Cork WR, reviewed separately.
review.name: Far more reasonable self-arrest tool than the original

review.reviewBody: Perfect for any trekker to shave some weight and not bring an ice axe.
review.name: What a great invention!!!

name: UL Alpine Whippet Adze Attachment

review.reviewBody: This is my favorite carabiner. The color is nice if I need to use it for a bail carabiner or if I just use it for gear.
review.name: Nice & Bright

review.reviewBody: I'm still using about a dozen of the original hot-wires I bought in the 90's. The gate action is as good as ever and I have never had 1 get sticky. They are the most long lasting carabiners I have ever had. The rest of my rack is on original neutrinos which are just as good as the hot-wires. I can't say enough about how well these have held up. 15 Bigwalls and well over 1000 days of climbing over the last 25 years
review.name: super durable workhorse

review.reviewBody: Not using this for anything crazier than attaching a Nalgene to my pack most of the time but couldn’t ask for a better carabiner for the job!
review.name: Solid for what it is!

review.reviewBody: Excellent wiregate caribiner for the price. I use this for quickdraws, gear, camping, light rigging, or anywhere a high quality caribiner is needed.
review.name: Excellent standard wiregate caribiner

review.reviewBody: Used these to make some alpine draws. They work as advertised. Gate action is nice. We'll see how the gates hold up after a few seasons but for now I'm happy with them.
review.name: A good Carimexican at a good price.

review.reviewBody: The Petzl has a round opening for a rope safety clip. The shape of these carabiners isn't a good fit with a round hole. They functioned just fine, but removing them was hard as they would get locked in place. I'm sure they are great for other uses, but not this one.
review.name: Didn't work with my Petzl Ascender as a rope safety

review.reviewBody: This carabiner is without doubt my favorite non-locker on the market. I use it for many different aspects of my climbing.
review.name: Great quality for price

review.reviewBody: Have hotwire on my quickdraws and I use them on my alpine drawers. Work smoothly with easy clip in to bolts and clipping your rope.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody:
Click: My Hotwire Carabiner Changed Everything 
I placed a screw deep into solid ice and then backed it up with a stopper. The stance was solid, one more pitch to the summit of the Aiguille. I used a hotwire to clip into the belay. I heard the distinct click over the gentle wind. It “clicked” for me. I belayed my partner up. When she arrived, I knew I had to ask her to marry me. Years later now, the mountains we climb are different: work, house, responsibilities, two happy children. I drive the youngest to baseball practice. The same Hotwire biner, now carefully holds my car keys, and I fidget with it during the game. Thanks Black Diamond for protecting me in my adventurous, mountain years.
review.name: It Clicked...

review.reviewBody: Great ‘biner. Fits the hand, easy to manoeuvre. I like it!
review.name: Solid performer

name: HotWire Carabiner

review.reviewBody: First time buying an insulated puffer so not a lot to compare to. Happy after four days in the rain using this as a mid-layer to stay warm at camp and at night, lows under 50 if I had to guess. Seems to dry pretty quickly after getting wet. Have also used around town but it’s a tad warm for that. Only downside is things fall out of the pocket very easily when not zipped. I’m 5’10, 175 and got an M. I like the slim/tailored fit for a mid under my rain jacket.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: Perfect insulation weight and well-made.
review.name: Great product!

review.reviewBody: Warm 30-50 degrees w just a T on. Super lightweight. Packable. Hood fits like a glove,  zippered pockets. Love it.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody:
Very warm and light for size. 
For me, the fit is small, mainly due to the non adjustable, quite tight fitting hood and a little narrower than usual across the shoulders for "a regular" fit. I moved to XL which is better, but the hood would still benefit from some adjustment to be able to pull it back off my face. 
Don't be put off though it is an excellent jacket if it fits you.
review.name: Very warm and light for

review.reviewBody: A really nice bit of kit. Very light and breathable. I wore and carried this every day for 2 weeks in the alps. The only improvement I'd suggest is a 2 way zip to make it more usable as a belay jacket.
review.name: A really nice bit of

review.reviewBody: This is a great item of clothing to pack for a hike. It packs up very small, is light and when used keeps you very well protected from the wind. I had originally thought its use would be occasional and limited, but it has quickly become my "go to" layer for everyday wear.
review.name: This is a great item

review.reviewBody: Got Xenair Alpine and Alpine Light, both great! Fit is great, especially movement in the shoulders, comfortable and must have piece for your layering system.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: Great slim fit and keeps the sleeve length (rare for a tall thin bloke!). Excellent under a harness on windy sea cliffs or as an extra layer on a multi-pitch belay. Also perfectly acceptable for the pub afterwards!!
review.name: Great slim fit and keeps

review.reviewBody:
The perfect summer/alpine insulated jacket.
Packs down really well. Warmth for weight is outstanding. Absolutely great for packing into an alpine pack.
review.name: The perfect summer/alpine insulated jacket.

review.reviewBody: A quality item, it’s warm, versatile and effective. And it looks good!!
review.name: A quality item, it’s warm,

review.reviewBody:
These are my favorite trail running shoes and my favorite hiking boots. They're distinguished by a snug, cockpit-like fit and a sole that manages to handle everything well: the rubber is sticky for smooth stuff and the lugs are aggressive for loose stuff. They really inspire confidence on all but the wettest/slickest/smoothest obstacles. 

They're not for you if you need lots of cushioning, have a very wide forefoot, or have too strong a sense of fashion—these are fabulously ugly. I'd also recommend against them if you need something you'll wear around town. The rubber is very soft and I don't think it will hold up long on pavement. I use some all-purpose Brooks running shoes around town and on easy trail runs, and keep these for when they count. 

They are sized small. You may need a size up from what you're used to. Best bet is probably to order a few sizes and try them around the house to figure out which is yours. I did this, and then had to pick the right insole and use a shoe stretcher to enlarge the toe box a bit. But they've now served me well for 3 years. 

One other negative: the heel loops are fragile. Go easy on them or you might tear them off.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody:
I've worn this shoe for 2 weeks straight. 1 week to break in. Then I ran a 20-mile trail run and I didn't think about them at all, which is all I can hope for in trail running shoes. 

In the second week I started noticing some rubbing/hot-spot on slight left of my back heel (achilles). Unfortunately while putting on the shoes the finger loop heel tab ripped.
review.name: Good for trail runs, but ripped heel tab

review.reviewBody:
Been obsessively looking for a good low top shoe for regular hard trail running, rock scrambling, dog walking,  hiking, etc. Over the winter I was using the mid/ hightop UltraRaptors and they are great but not such a good summer shoe. These mutants looked like they could be a sweet lightweight, but solid, summer adventure shoe.  Got them and was initially psyched about the look, the soles are gnarly deep, the toe bumper solid, the lacing system a bit strange but kinda cool. Put them on and walked around my house a bit and they jist felt hard. Like no soft heel or insoles. It wrapped my foot tighly, which is great for hikes/approaches, rock scrambling, but it also felt more annoying than functional. Would probably break in a bit. But, over the course of a day and night I just kept putting them on wanting them to feel nice but they didn't. Just meh. Not saying they are bad quality, but the "feel" inside the shoe just made me want to take them off and get into something more comfortable. Couldn't imagine spending all day in these. 

Well, I'm sure these may be great for some people, but for me, not the "ones".  Though I love Backcountry and their customer service is always A+. 

Side note. I usually wear a 9.5 in most shoes but in these Mutants I got size 10(43) which felt like. 9.5. Most Sportiva shoes feel a half size smaller than say Adidas, Nike, Scarpa, 5.10, etc. 

Hope some of this helps other find their perfect adventure shoes
review.name: Meh...

name: Mutant Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I have a couple pair of Hokas & needed a half-size bump in OC’s. Their design has a forward rock that I like, but prompted the half-size boost. 
The photos in the gallery do the shoes justice. The Black/Cobalt has a fantastic earthy dark plum to black fade with flashes of cobalt blue. A terrific look. I’ll be using these to work on my feet & casual trail hiking 85/15. I didn’t want/need an aggressive tread on the soles, as is evident in Speedgoats, etc. 
The cushioning under heel is spectacular, way softer than my Hokas. Extremely curious to see how they wear/compress over time.
I have wide feet as a girl shopping the men’s runners, and feel no pressure points/hot spots thus far—anywhere! No dig across the top of the foot above the toes, as is common with stiffer/more rigid shoe designs. OC’s are super comfy right outta the box.
review.name: Don’t Sleep on OC

name: Cloudsurfer Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I am still looking forward to putting the Ventia through its paces, but initial impressions of these bibs are very good. Insulation is not too bulky but adds warmth. The fit is true to size, they are comfortable, and seem to be well made.
review.name: Just as described

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, warm, stretchy bib that I strongly recommend.
review.name: Bobbin is livin

review.reviewBody: Big boy here, but that doesn't mean they need to be so baggy in the leg/ankle. Good material, warm (skied a few days in the mid to high teens. Would buy again, just wish they were a little more tapered down the leg.
review.name: Great quality for the price, would buy again

review.reviewBody: I love these bibs. I've used them for snowboarding about five times now, and they've been life-changing. They keep me dry, and are easy to maneuver in. The zipper in the middle makes bathroom breaks very easy too.
review.name: Dry, warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: + Light weight + Medium warmness + Ok water resistant - Questionable durability - Fit I'm 5'10" 185 lb, my jean sizes are 34" waist and 30" length. I bought size Medium/Short. Length and waist are just right. But very wide around the chest (see picture) Fly zipper flap are too narrow, causing to flip open. From the distant it looks like I have my fly open (see picture). Only the zipper pocket is usable, other chest pock with velcro can't secure your wallet or cellphone.
review.name: Good Bib with Shortcomings

review.reviewBody: They're nice and built well except for the lack of being waterproof. I was soaked last ski weekend & got quite cold because of it
review.name: Nice but not waterproof?

review.reviewBody: As a professional adventure photographer, I really do appreciate a piece of equipment that can withstand a lot of abuse. This is my second set of bibs as I put about 400 days outdoors on the first set. I spend 100 days a year in the snow, rolling around and doing all kinds of things most people won't do to get the shot. For a lot of people, they will never wear out. Thanks for keeping me warm and cosy.
review.name: Really great working rolling around bibs

review.reviewBody: They've been great so far!
review.name: Good pants

review.reviewBody: Use these bibs skiiing in Alaska, they're warm enough to keep you going without getting drenched in sweat, and very durable.
review.name: Great durable bibs

review.reviewBody: These are the most well made products! I use these bibs hunting and although they are not real thick they break the wind They are water resistant and warm. I love these bibs OR has the best products
review.name: Snowcrew Bibs

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very narrow fit so had to return but they looked like a good design

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Decent bike shoes.  I'm the owner of a very old and battered pair of Specialized Tahoes.  I would have done a like-for-like replacement, but they are no longer in production.  The five tens seemed good, so I took the plunge.

The recommendation is to size up, which I did (half a size).  As they are narrow (and my foot wide) it has meant the widest part of my foot doesn't quite sit at the widest part of the shoe.  I've had similar issues with other Adidas shoes and am hoping these stretch a little.  It isn't unbearable, but I'd prefer an experience on the bike where I don't even notice my feet at all.

The shoes themselves seem well made.  Walking with the cleats attached is great and on the bike they feel stiff enough.  I've not been able to test them in a wide range of temperatures yet, but at close to 10 degrees (Celcius) my feet felt fine.
review.name: Good purchase (but narrow).

review.reviewBody: Really comfortable for the gym, good for running too !
review.name: Love em

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable, well designed, great color scheme. Serves the purposed of riding the trails and walking to the coffee shop
review.name: Great all around cycling shoe

review.reviewBody:
I have always liked the look of the Lazer G1.  I’m completely bald (always have been) and am really picky about good ventilation as it is obvious to me how a helmet performs in that area.  I also live in Texas where 100 degree rides are common.
The helmet is as well ventilated as the most ventilated I have owned at least.  I have been riding since the 80’s and MTB and road since the 90’s.  Shape is similar to Giro.  The head ‘cradle’ structure which I suppose makes this a MIPS helmet very naturally hugs your head with no pressure points.  In many years of riding I have cracked some helmets on and off road.  I always walked away alive.  It had been over 20 years since my last spill of that type.  I bought a second Lazer G1 helmet in white for some variety.  About a week later riding perhaps too quickly on an asphalt trail after several days of rain, I hit an algae-like slick patch on the apex of a turn. It was like ice.  I ended pretty badly bruised and with raspberry pie along my entire left side.  I had gone off the trail into some concrete erosion barriers.  While a bit dazed, my Lazer saved me.  I rode half a mile further stopping at a bench to self assess.
The helmet had two significant imprints of the concrete barriers.  It happened so quickly that I did not remember hitting my head.  Ultimately, my point is the helmet feels like it disappears when on from the nice fit and ventilation AND it did it’s job!  I’m alive yet again to continue riding.  I ordered the exact same helmet again by the end of the day.
review.name: Great ventilation and saved my life!

review.reviewBody: Helmet has design issue with front padding, wears out very quickly and neither Competitive Cyclist, nor the Mfg stands behind it.
review.name: Recommend do not purchase

review.reviewBody: Super lightweight, high quality lid.  Only question will be how durable it proves to be as the rear cradle and mech are very minimalist.
review.name: Nice Lid!

review.reviewBody:
This is my third Lazer helmet, and the highest rated Lazer road helmet at Virginia Tech.
I love their tightening mechanism. I have long hair, and it's much more comfortable than the dial at the back. Even without it, though, it pinches my head less than the dial at the back. This helmet is lightweight and comfortable. The only downside is that the color selection is kind of bland. I would have liked one safety color, since I use this for commuting, or something other than primarily black unless it's white.
review.name: quality helmet.

review.reviewBody: glasses wouldnt store in the helmet well and the cinch mechanism got in the way of wearing glasses. Also cinch was hard to tighten down enough. eveything else was good about the helmet, only used a few times before returning
review.name: good helmet but some issues for me

review.reviewBody: Returned before using. I really wanted this helmet to work since it is rated very high on Virginia Tech. I have hair and it keep getting caught in the front of the helmet.  Also, suggestions about the fit being an odd shape I agree with.  Helmet was tight from front to back, but gaping on the sides.  Way to much play to have the added pads fill.  Loved the bright color!
review.name: Fit is Weird

review.reviewBody: Seems like a great helmet: light, highly rated etc. But the helmet has a thin hard plastic attachment that fits around the back of your head which holds the helmet in place. This part of the helmet is integral to the design but only appears in one of the pictures advertising the helmet. Without hair the plastic is instantly uncomfortable - deal breaker.
review.name: Requires hair

review.reviewBody:
I ordered the light blue sunset in size Medium at the recommendation of CC customer service.  I currently own and love the Z1, but it's now over 5 years old and in need of replacement.  I measured 56cm, and normally take a small in helmets (my Z1 is a small) but that wasn't available in the G1 in this color.  Since my size puts me between the Small or Medium, customer service checked and said the shape of this helmet (more oval than the Z1, which is pretty round) would still fit me.  

It is even prettier in person, but when I put it on, it definitely looked a bit big to me.  I had to move the sizing wheel almost to the tightest level, and it fit, but there was a large gap in the back of the helmet between the plastic frame that tightens down and the helmet itself.  I just felt that it had unnecessary room and it really looked like I should go with a small.  I'll have to wait until Lazer restocks it and will try again.  Even the white in a size small is out of stock here :(.
review.name: Beautiful helmet, just didn't fit
comment: I had same experience with a Medium, sightly big and tightening left too much spacing, and then I ordered Small. Unfortunately, small is too tight. It seems this helmet, neither a medium nor small, won't fit my head.

review.reviewBody:
This helmet was easy to adjust and get to fit on my head. Unfortunately, the front two MIPS buttons snagged my hair (long, tied back in a ponytail) no matter how careful I was about removing the helmet. 

Also FYI, this G1 MIPS size medium weighed 271 grams on my scale, not 235 as advertised (Other helmets I'ved weighed have weighed true, this scale is accurate). Maybe it's 235 grams without the MIPS liner?
review.name: Long hair gets caught in MIPS buttons

review.reviewBody:
The first time you go to pick it up you'll be amazed there's even something in your hand. Weighing in at just 235g it's one of the lightest helmets out there. Personally, I've had a lot of trouble fitting most helmet brands, but the Lazer G1 Mips helmet is finally an exception! I'm always worried that the retention system will just pull the helmet backward on my head, but luckily, once I made the macro adjustment inside the helmet, the outer adjustment worked beautifully. Because the retention system falls down a bit lower on the head than a lot of other helmets, it can get in the way of sunglasses that have really straight arms. My Smith sunglasses interfere with the retention bands under the back of the helmet, so they won't stay in place on my face, but I'm probably an odd case. Anyway, having to swap out for different shades is a small price to pay for such a nice helmet.

The side straps are sufficiently adjustable as well and are not at all uncomfortable once you set them right. My one gripe with the helmet is that there is no sunglasses storage factored into the design. I've come to love the ability to quickly take my sunglasses off and store them tightly and securely by sliding the arms into the helmet. For various reasons most riders don't keep their shades on for 100% of a ride, so it's a nice feature to have, but one that I can look past for a helmet as light and comfortable as this. It's sleek (doesn't appear bulbous), the colorways are stylish, it looks pro, it'll help make you feel faster, and it's extremely lightweight. I've only been able to ride outside so many times this winter with it but I'm already picturing so many epic rides with this beautiful helmet atop my noggin.
review.name: You won't even know it's there

name: G1 Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: Highly durable bag. Water resistant.  I have room to put many objects in. Easy access to pockets.

review.reviewBody: This bag makes s such a great color, (burnt orange) and had just the right amount of space. The price was great too.

review.reviewBody: Amazing quality, heavy duty. I love this bag! Will most likely last for many years.
review.name: Absolutely love!

review.reviewBody:
Creative, stylish, functional, and durable.  Two larger pockets (with vertical zippers) hold books, an extra shirt, and 1 to 2 water bottles.  Zipper pocket on the inside of the bag for car keys or wallet.  Two outside pockets seem designed for a cell phone (medium pocket) and a deck of cards (smallest pocket).
I would avoid this as a primary travel bag.  Think of it more as a purse or a “day pack”.  I bought it for my wife who is 5’ 1” and she said it was too big.  So now I wear it (I’m 5’9”).
review.name: I really like the bag!

review.reviewBody: Holds so many things, is small and has a shoulder strap. Perfect for hiking!
review.name: Great for hiking

review.reviewBody: I bought this Kavu bag and matching wallet for my 2 week trip to Italy🇮🇹. It is perfect! Holds my wallet, water bottle, documents and more!! And I love the green print‼️
review.name: Kavu bag and matching wallet the BEST!

review.reviewBody: So happy with this bag, I can fit all my stuff plus things my kids may need, like snacks or juice boxes. Very glad I bought it!
review.name: Perfect bag for on the go people

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect size for a wallet, one diaper, and a small container of wipes. I’ve used it instead of my diaper bag every single time I’ve been out with my kids and I’ve received like 4 compliments. I’m super impressed!
review.name: The Perfect Size!

review.reviewBody: You can’t get more versatile than this for a bag in my opinion.  I can get sunglasses and my phone in the front.  In one side, I can fit a Kanken makeup bag full of stuff, a note pad, and a change purse with room to spare.  On the other side, I keep 3 Baggus, my keys, and my air pods.  I’ve worn it across my back and tossed over one shoulder.  It’s  comfortable both ways.   The only thing I’d change is I’d put a larger piece of Velcro on the pocket for glasses.  That’s not a deal breaker, though.  You just need to make sure it’s closed.
review.name: Versatile Bag

review.reviewBody: This bag is literally so cute! I love the designs and it carries everything I need for a day out. Wallet, keys, water, snacks, and more!

review.reviewBody: I like that this jacket folds up into a convenient storage pouch. I haven’t been able to use it much I have other items that seem to work better for the temperatures in my area. I thought it would be a good outer layer for fall or spring temps.
