review.reviewBody: This is a great jacket. Trim fitting, enough room in all the right places, very lightweight and packable. The only reason I did not rate five stars is because there are no reflective patches on it. I think that would be a nice addition. And the zippers could be a little more sturdy.
review.name: Great jacket, but not reflective.

review.reviewBody: This jacket is worth the investment. High quality weatherproofing makes it a perfect outer shell and I can layer under that to fit the conditions. Perfect for keeping out the winter wind and rain we get so much of where I live.
review.name: Worth the investment

review.reviewBody: A quality jacket that does all that it advertises, however it sits a bit short at the waist. An extra 3/4 to an inch of fabric would make it perfect.
review.name: A quality jacket

review.reviewBody: great looking jacket with lot of pockets. it is useful for rainy/ windy days.  For real cold it is not enough by itself, you  have to layer it.

I waited until I had this jacket for at least a year and all 4 seasons to write a review. Overall, I like the jacket but there are a few things to note.

Highlights: The jacket is lightweight, feeling almost papery thin. It works great as my primary running and XC ski jacket, and my everyday jacket in the fall and spring. I find it works as a perfect running outer layer over a sports tee in the temp range from ~25F to 45F and up through warmer temps for casual use. The fit is loose enough to comfortably layer an added longsleeve for colder temps but fitted enough that the silhouette is not baggy on my fairly thin "runners build". The hood and 3 zippered pockets are appreciated! The buttons under the main zipper are super useful for airflow if you start getting warm and they keep the jacket from flapping wildly around as you run. All running jackets should have these buttons. 

Cons: The buttons need to be more solidly placed. The long end is placed in fabric that is doubled back and works well. However, it's button partner along the zipper is simply placed through one layer of fabric and it ripped through the first time I unbuttoned it. You really need to hold tight along that button to prevent any damage when unsnapping. Some needle and thread worked to seal up the tear on my damaged button. Second, this is not a waterproof jacket. Curiously, I noted that web searches, including results showing products from the Brooks site, list it as waterproof but the actual product page on the Brooks site does not make this claim. At first, water beaded up and shed readily, but whatever coating or fabric magic did this wore off after a few months. Water soaks through fairly readily now in a decent rain.
review.name: Great jacket but not waterproof and buttons could be reinforced

review.reviewBody: My husband loves this jacket so much he had me order another.  I have the women’s version and it’s a great, super light weight jacket that provides just enough protection and warmth when you aren’t sure if it’s jacket weather or not
review.name: Jacket weather?

name: Canopy Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I wear this mock neck several times a week! It's my new favorite piece for the fall and winter. It's cozy and warm, and super soft. I've gotten so many compliments on it already and I've only had it a few weeks! I got a medium and it fits perfectly over sized! For reference I'm a size small usually so it does run bigger but it's perfect! Will definitely be buying the black one!!!
review.name: Wonder pile fleece mock neck

review.reviewBody: I got the light cream color of this, very cute and very soft. Only annoying part is that the arm is too connected to the sides so when you try putting on a vest or a coat it bunches up and looks/fits weird. As someone who lives in Breckenridge this makes it lightly irritating for when it's really cold out but I still enjoy this product a lot. Steep price point though.
review.name: I like but hard to put jacket on top

review.reviewBody: Very disappointed poor quality not even worm will return
review.name: Cheap looking

hasVariant.name: Aether Spherical Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Giro Aether Spherical Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very dissappointed as this is a quality product no doubt. BUT, when in my aggressive riding position all you can see is the inside front of the helmet. It is the right size and I tried to make all the adjustments expected. I guess the moulding is not suited to me.
review.name: Aether Spherical Helmet

review.reviewBody: I had a major crash at over 50 km-h.  The helmet destroyed, but my head intact!!  I bought another one identical.  The MIPS really works!  I highly recommend
review.name: It saved my life

review.reviewBody: Fit is great as is the style. For whatever reason, my white helmet has gradually discolored to have orange streaks at all of the creases.
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: This is really nice helmet.  Most importantly for me is the amount of ventilation it provides.  Unfortunately I sweat a lot and have always had issues with sweat dripping, mucked up glasses, etc. It is truly the first helmet I have owned where I feel air flowing over my head during a ride without thinking about it.  It is very comfortable and light weight. It's the best road riding helmet I have owned in about 35 years of riding and trying different helmets.  A bit on the pricey side.
review.name: Aether spherical helmet

review.reviewBody: The Giro Aether Spherical helmet is an excellent piece of equiment. It's comfortable, lightweight, and stylish all in one. Thank you, Competitive Cyclist, for the outstanding service and product selection.
review.name: The Great Giro Aether Spherical

review.reviewBody:
I have run the gamut for buying a new helmet to replace my Synthe, which started to pull out more and more of my longer hair.  So, I wanted a MIPS but without the yellow discs.  I also took the opportunity to try other brands along with Giro, because I've only had Giro helmets and thought others might be better for me. I was especially concerned about having enough space between the helmet and sunglasses. I did order the Aether in my first batch of orders and immediately sent it back because it didn't feel right. After trying some other helmets, I decided that maybe I made a rush decision, so I ordered it again, especially since my husband loves his Aether. Again, it just didn't feel right on me--I was very conscious that "something" was on my head. 
I've finally decided on the Helios, which was in the first batch of helmets I tried, when I still felt a need to compare Giro to others. The Helios feels good, and I don't think I'll notice it when I actually ride in it. 
I tried cheaper Giros, a Bell, a Lazer, and a Kask sphere. Of those I liked the fit of the Kask sphere, especially in regard to forehead space. However, I had assumed "sphere" meant no MIPS discs, but it had them, so back it went.
review.name: Not comfortable for me

review.reviewBody:
Had this helmet for the better part of the summer... until I crashed and dented and cracked the shell. Spoiler alert it did its job. Though it’s not the lightest helmet I have owned the safety features out perform anything. The spherical mips is no joke. I used this helmet cross county mountain biking, gravel, and road. I would highly recommend this helmet even though it’s pricey. 

My head is 60cm around and I bought a large.
review.name: Life saver

review.reviewBody: I really like this helmet. Very light and well ventilated. MIPS allows micro adjustments? Reason for 4-star rating: Because I'm a heavy sweater I'll be curious to see how it works in the hot summer months since I just purchased my new one in the last month.  I have a very large  head and the more aerodynamic design of this helmet doesn't look overly large on my head like my previous helmets.
review.name: Tim Miller
comment:
Tim, I'm a heavy sweater too and I'm curious if you would recommend this helmet? 

Thank you in advance

review.reviewBody: This helmet runs smaller than described. I have owned many helmets over my 25 years of riding. I measured as usual and it was very uncomfortable without the rear lock even tightened. I would recommend going a size up if you purchase. Hopefully it will be more comfortable for you. :)
review.name: Helmet Sizing

review.reviewBody:
I recently bought this for my wife. We ride around 50-60 miles a week and she hadn't updated her helmet in years so we felt like we could splurge on a new one. We are both fans of the MIPS system. She loves the matte blue color and it is pretty rad! 

Her feedback: light, good ventilation, very wide in appearance but comfortable adjustment system. She has a smaller head and could have purchased the Small but went with the Medium and was happy with her choice.
review.name: Great helmet

name: Aether Spherical Helmet

review.reviewBody: So backcountry has the wrong size chart.   This shoe is listed in three last widths on the chart, standard, wide and extra wide.  On lakes website the race plus last are listed as narrow, regular and wide.   So if you buy the wide width on backcountry, you are buying the shoe that has the widest last. (instead of the shoe that has the middle sized width)  Looking at lakes chart they said they changed the designation in 2023. but backcountry has not updated their chart.  So i bought the wrong size..
review.name: THey have the wrong size chart.

review.reviewBody: Started my ride this morning at 34 degrees with the wind chill at 27.  This was the coldest I've attempted yet with these, and they were perfectly warm for the full 1.5 hours.  At this temp range I'm typically in a liner glove with a lobster glove over the top - this is the coldest I've attempted a full finger, and I believe that I could go 5-10 degrees more (maybe).  I have a very hard time keeping my fingers warm, and have literally tried EVERY glove imaginable.  These are the warmest yet.  I typically wear a medium in most gloves, but went with a large in these to be able to wear a liner.  Turns out that the additional lining makes them fit more snugly, so I can't get a liner in them.  BUT, that's ok as these are warm enough to not need it anyway.  So make sure you size up from what you would wear typically for proper fit.  As far as range, I don't think I'd attempt to wear these much above 45 degrees as they would be too warm making my hands sweat.  But from there down to maybe the upper 20's these are sublime.  Highly recommend.
review.name: Warmest Full Fingers Yet - watch sizing

name: Siberian 2.0 Glove - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Ulvo 30L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the Fjällräven Ulvö 30 backpack last year, and overall, it has proven to be a reliable companion for various activities. However, there is a notable issue that I would like to highlight.
Pros:**
1. **Durability:** The build quality of the Ulvö 30 is commendable durable 
2. **Comfortable Wear:** The backpack offers a comfortable and adjustable fit.
3. **Ample Storage Space:** With a 30-liter capacity, the Ulvö provides sufficient room.
4. **Water-Resistant Material:** The backpack's material provides a descent level of water resistance. 
5. **Well-Designed Compartments:** Thoughtful organized. Not bad Not great.
*Cons:**
**Style Compromise:** One significant drawback I've observed is that the Ulvö 30 loses its aesthetic appeal when the upper compartment is filled. The pressure from the contents causes the bag to compress from top to bottom, resulting in a somewhat slouched appearance.
review.name: 1 Year Review & Overall Impressions

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable bag. Lots of pockets make it really practical. The straps around the waist and chest made it great for hiking but the bag is also suitable for using for over night work trips. The only downside I found was that my back got quite warm against the padding.
review.name: Great Bag

review.reviewBody:
The backpack is extremely spacious and has several pockets for storing a few odds and ends. it’s impeccably streamlined and has stayed relatively clean. the side pockets are particularly impressive, they stretch, but unlike most backpacks they arent showing any signs of breakage. there’s plenty of external space for carabiners and clip on attachments. the internal side pocket can get tight, if you pack the backpack too wide. the breathability is a bit restrictive but is quickly made up for by the hardworking internal frame that can handle just about any jagged item you throw at it.

it should be noted that the hip straps sit a little high (around the navel area instead of below). after a few months the shoulder straps are showing a little fraying but the external material is holding fine.
review.name: Fjallraven nailed it again

review.reviewBody: Just got this bag and have been using it for only a few days but already enjoying it!! The top of the bag is spacious with that big pocket for quick access items and then inside of the actual bag there are almost three separate compartments. There is a laptop sleeve, the general big compartment, and then one smaller one at the front that is also separated from the big one. Therefore, this allows to keep your stuff organized while also giving you a lot of space to stuff the bag. I commute a lot by bike and always like to have space in my bag for extra stuff in case I buy anything on the way home. I was able to fit a whole shoebox in here plus extra such as bike lock, and more! Overall, it's a very durable bag.
review.name: Great Backpack

review.reviewBody: This is a great rucksack because the main compartment is waterproof which is definitely an upgrade over my previous bag that was only water resistant. It feels good to wear and the material is of high quality. The zips are really sturdy and aren't over the top with loads of compartments. However, there is only one complaint I have about this bag and that is that the drink pouches on either side will not hold a full bottle in them, if you lean over your bottle will go flying. I am often cycling so whenever I reach down for something my bottle falls out, this has often caused my bottle to break so I keep having to buy new ones. If this bag were to be upgraded I would ask that you add an adjustable strap to these pouches like the one above the pouch (that a bottle does not reach) so I can secure any drink.
review.name: A great backpack with only one annoying flaw

name: Ulvo 30L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Very warm for a 3 season and reasonably priced. I was happy to get a synthetic that is so warm and at my price point. Spring time in S Devon around 10°c at night it's almost too warm.... and I feel the cold! I'd be confident sleeping in this around 0°
review.name: Very warm for a 3

review.reviewBody: Used on Dartmoor in April I was able to assess that yes, it is comfortable down to zero degrees but beyond that don't expect a perfect nights sleep. At -5 I was struggling to get good sleep. So the EN temp rating is accurate. (I'm 47, female) Bag is well made, and not restrictive, rather too much footbox/lower leg space for me (I'm 5'11"). Snugs up well to the face. At 1.2kg it's not too heavy for multiday trips. I look forward to seeing where synthetic tech goes in the near future, it's getting warmer and lighter all the time.
review.name: Solid bag

name: Solar Eco 3 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'10" and 140lbs, and the size medium is too small, but the main problem is the fact that the straps are not stretchy and/or long enough. Maybe these would work for someone about 5'6" and maybe 130lbs?
review.name: Fit all wrong

review.reviewBody: Just like all other reviews these bibs run small. Although I usually up-size my bibs from medium to large simply for comfort, I should have heeded the advice from others and chose an XLg bib. But, I did not and and chose size large and they fit me but snuggly. I'm sticking with them for when I need the extra compression.  I find the fabric isn't as porous as I prefer but they should be fine during cooler weather rides. These will not be my preference during hot or humid weather conditions. Overall, they seem well constructed with comfortable seams, straps, and chamois pad.
review.name: Giving Rapha bibs a try

review.reviewBody: I try to spend money on 3 most important bicycling products where quality makes a big difference, and bib shorts are #1, to prevent chaffing etc, especially on those difficult long rides. Quite impressed with the quality of fabric, chamois and feel of this Rapha, thought it was just a hype or style, but they have stepped it up and quite happy with them, they run true to slightly small to size, so order appropriately. Usually I wear Assos, Sugoi, Castelli, because they fit best for me as Size Small , but will add  Rapha to my list.
review.name: Rapha for real

name: Core Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: Was not as insulated as I need, hard to believe it is 800 fill.  I run on the cold side, even when hiking in the backcountry, so having warm gear is essential for me during winter. I ordered a medium so that i could layer underneath and not be constricted, It fit as expected.  I did not wear it outside so I can not speak to its warmth factor,  but the look of it, the thin feel of it did not exude heat.  The outer layer seemed a little flimsy as well. I should have read more thoroughly in description because they do say it is a Mid layer coat.  If that is what you are looking for then it is perfect, might even be a 4 or 5 star for you.
review.name: Returned

review.reviewBody: Super bulky fit, not what I was looking for. Probably okay for city wear but definitely wouldn’t work for extensive outdoor use. Returned :(
review.name: Returned

review.reviewBody: Not as insulated as I wanted. Returned for another coat

Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody:
This is a perfect hat between 30° and 70° when the weather is nasty. 

The wider brim is awesome and wearing this is like having a roof over your head. 

It breathes only slightly so it traps heat well but isn't great for hot temperatures. I haven't pushed the waterproofness to its limit but for a few hours outside in the hail / sleet / rain it's been the most welcome ally.
review.name: Shelter

review.reviewBody: I am an International Mountain Leader which includes snowshoeing. I bought these because as a leader I really need a reliable pair of snowshoes and these looked good quality. On the first day of use one of the front pivot rivets came out and was lost and no spares had come with them. Luckily I wasn't leading the trip, but it was still pretty embarrassing, and it could have been disastrous if I had been in a remote location.
review.name: Useless. They broke on the first day

review.reviewBody: LOVE the convenience and comfort of the new bindings. Same MSR quality frame with great traction in our PNW conditions. Bravo!
review.name: So quick. So comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Super easy to use boot binding system. I love how quiet they are, lightweight and great traction and flotation.
review.name: Super easy to use boot

review.reviewBody:
Compact enough to fit on my pack when not in use. 
Light weight so I barely notice them.
Well made and the straps stay tightened no matter what the terrain or snow depth. 
Love the heel bar and the serrated edges on the bottom of the frame for those dicey up hills and icy sections. 
Great on trail in packed snow or off and in fresh powder.
review.name: All around great snowshoe

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these - they have been great and they shipped quickly
review.name: Good buy

review.reviewBody: Loved my new snowshoes! Very lightweight and easy to get on and off. The slimmer version (womans) was great too as I wasn't stepping on my shoes when walking.
review.name: Loved my new snowshoes! Very

review.reviewBody: Light weight, comfortable, easy to put on and take off, and great traction.
review.name: Light weight, comfortable, easy to

review.reviewBody: These go on and off easily and stayed on well in deep snow. Great grip just like my older MSR snowshoes.
review.name: Awesome snowshoes

review.reviewBody: These snowshoes are light, easy to put on, adjust, and take off. They move beautifully in all kinds of snow with great traction. Even sticky snow does not build up underfoot.
review.name: Excellent and easy

review.reviewBody: These are the BEST. Climbing hard pack snow with some ice they are excellent.
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: Very nice looking boot.  I changed the laces to a dark brown and they look better.  The leather is very nice.  It will take a while to break-in but it should be worth it.  I did have to change the insoles to a Superfeet Runner insole.  The ones which come with this are just okay and have minimal arch support.  The new ones are much better for cushioning and my high arches. I plan to wear these a lot and spend a lot of time on my feet.
review.name: Great looking and comfy boot
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you and you figured out an insole what works best in them. We are excited to serve you again!

review.reviewBody: These are great boots and I like them but the leather on the left boot seems to be stretched across the toe box such that it crimps my toes when I walk.  The right boot does not have this problem.  I had to return the first pair because the tongue on one of the pair I bought originally was cut improperly so it exposed the laces to the foot.  Otherwise, these are good boots.
review.name: Nice boots but crimping toes
comment: Thanks for this great review! We are excited to serve you again!

review.reviewBody: They are very comfortable they're great boot well built. I love the leather. They are wearing nicely thank you
review.name: My weekender boots
comment: We are glad to hear that these Weekender Chukkas have been providing you with comfort and are wearing nicely. Thank you for taking your time to leave us this review!

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes after forgetting a pair of nice shoes for a wedding. I put some good miles on them that night, and had slight blistering as would be expected for a brand new pair of leather shoes. The very next day, I was skeptical, so I read some reviews. This was a common complaint for customers not willing to take the time to break them in, but as I read more and more reviews, I discovered it takes a good couple days before they start to form to your foot. I gave them some time, and sure enough, the blister never returned and the shoes became more comfortable. I typically wear Vans skate shoes, but now I'm leaning towards these being my daily shoe. Unlike Vans, the support of these Redwing shoes is top notch and I can go all day without foot fatigue. If you're considering a pair of these, keep in mind they do take time to break in. Be patient and let the leather get comfortable with the shape of your foot. You won't regret it.
review.name: Snug fit that gets better as they wear in.
comment: Thank you for this great feedback! I am so glad these are working so well, even with the tough break in period.

review.reviewBody: I've had my Weekender Chukkas for 2 years now. They're my favorite shoes period...! I will say they took a while to break-in but are now the most comfortable shoes I own. I can wear them all day and they look great! I wish you still made them in black. I'd order a pair in a heartbeat!!!
review.name: My Favorite Shoe...!
comment:
We are happy to hear that our Weekender Chukka is your favorite style shoe and have provided you with comfort over the years! We will make sure to pass along the color suggestion to our Product Development teams for future reference.
Thank you for the review!

review.reviewBody: I’ll save you the money do not buy this boot. Bought this 4 months ago and sole is starting to pull away. I wear these boots once a week.Cheaply made. I will no longer buy red wings
review.name: DONT BUY

review.reviewBody: Amazing everyday chukka. Exactly the quality you’d expect from Redwing Heritage line. BUT definitely size down. I ordered the 12 and they were huge! I am a 12-12.5 in sneakers but the 11’s I ordered for this boot are a perfect fit.
review.name: Great everyday, made in USA, chukka

review.reviewBody: I bought these as I love the look and I've had several red wings for work boots in the past. My dress Chukkas were chewed up by my dog so I went with these. Literally, my favorite shoe of all time. Very quick break in very easy to clean, and I get compliments all the time.
review.name: For about any occasion

review.reviewBody: Purchased these in 2022 and I appreciate the Red Wing quality, brand, and love the style. Great with khakis or jeans. Unlike the other lines of Heritage these are not that supportive. It's not a deal breaker but they also don't come in a wide width. For this I suffered an unpleasant break in. I'm good now but if it doesn't come in a wide width, I'll dream about it until RW decides to make it in a wide width.  In conclusion I like the shoes, wish that we had the option of the suede. This shoe requires a break in.
review.name: Good addition to your Heritage collection
comment: Thanks for your honest review! We appreciate your business and are glad you are enjoying your boots, minus the break in period.

review.reviewBody: I really like them, but wish they were easier to get on and off. I have a pair of the old(er) shoes and they are my favorites! They are 15 years old (or so) going strong and comfortable as heck. Wanted a replacement, and these are great, but...
review.name: Great, but wish they were shoes not boots
comment:
Thank you for the review! We are happy to hear that you enjoy these shoes! 
We will make sure to pass this information along to our Product Development teams to see more of a slip-on style for easier on-off wear. 
If you have any other suggestions or concerns, please reach out to our customer service department at 800-733-9464 or email into customer.service@redwingshoes.com and we will gladly pass it along.

name: Weekender Chukka Shoe - Men's
